Questions.question: How often do you hear from employees to adopt digital technologies?
What is the level of commitment, in 2020, to invest in a digital workforce?
How would you rate your employee's ability to use digital technology?
What are your targets for employee training that equips them with new digital skills by 2020?
Which mobile strategy fits your company better?
What are your plans, in 2020, to allow employees to bring and use their own applications for work?

answers.4: All Employees but with app limitations
answers.5: All Employees with no app limitations

Questions.question: What is the role of balancing business needs and employee satisfaction in your BYOD decisions?

answers.1: We focus more on Business Needs
answers.3: We focus more on Employee Satisfaction

Questions.question: What is the priority to include mobility reward programs to improve employee satisfaction in 2020?
What is the level of effort required for employees to set up their own device into your enterprise with access to email, applications, and systems?
How much have you planned for the challenges that growing device options and varied interface designs will impact device management and security in 2020?
How satisfied are you with the amount of company resources allocated to managing your BYOD policy?
How concerned are you of your BYOD policy becoming more costly, over the next few years, to manage than the value it brings?
What is your policy on letting your employees work anywhere?
How will you address a mobile-first workforce empowered by 5G? (Select all that apply)

answers.2: Expand Access to Company Provided Devices

Questions.question: How much of your workforce has access to internet-based communications?
Questions.subtext: e.g. messaging, voice, video, desktop sharing

Questions.question: How significant would it be to have AI-enhanced collaboration tools assisting your employees with day-to-day activities or in meetings?
What is the level of effort required in locating, managing, and instantly communicating with your mobile workforce?
How much are you prioritizing security and maintaining confidentiality while managing your mobile workforce?
How much of your forms are able to be filled and digitally signed on a mobile device?
By 2020, how much of the digital form data will be automated into business processes?
Questions.subtext: e.g. Analytics, Auto-Attachments, Training Data for AI/ML

Questions.question: What forms of payment can your mobile workforce accept?

answers.5: Previous & Chase, Visa, Mastercard, and/or Samsung

Questions.question: How are you considering addressing cryptocurrencies as a form of payment over the next few years?
How prepared are your employees and business to comply with all aspects of information and privacy laws in order to provide your service?
How well are you prepared to address the following compliance challenges over the next few years- storage requirements, new forms of data, and BYOx?
What percentage of your workforce - employees & contractors - based on their role and work, could work remotely?
Of the percentage that could work remotely, what is your target percentage to enable to work remotely by 2020?
How valuable is it to your employees to provide them with a company provided phone and connectivity?
What are your plans to equip your employees with next-gen mobile connected devices by 2020?
Questions.subtext: (e.g. Convertible Tablets & Laptops, Wearables & Smart Clothing, HUD & Immersive Displays)

Questions.question: What level of your workforce, based on role-based access rules, are able to access time-sensitive data accurately, from any device, from anywhere?
What is your goal for 2020?
What level of secure access does your mobile workforce have to email/communications, applications, data, and systems?
What network security systems are you looking at implementing in 2020, in order for your network to adapt to new attack vectors?

answers.3: Category Specific Security Systems (App, Data, Intrusion)

Questions.question: How resilient is your network to continue to provide normal operations to your mobile workforce?

answers.1: Can withstand normal increase in traffic
answers.2: Previous & high demands for short periods

Questions.question: With an increasing number of devices, larger datasets, and more security threats, what additional stressors to your network are you addressing?
How close to event occurrence are you able to process strategic and operational data and present it visually with limited delays?
How significant will UAVs, connected cameras, or other devices that can provide difficult to process data as an aid to employees?
How often do you research digital technologies that will enable and make your business more efficient?
Of the technologies that you've researched, how many do you think you'll implement by 2020?
Do you have a role under the CTO or any other executive who is leading your digitalization effort?
Do you have plans to have a Chief Digital Officer (or Office) who continue to lead your digitalization effort in 2020 and beyond?

answers.2: Role to Exist under other Executive

Questions.question: What is the level of data collection from your places of business, things you own, your employees, and your customers? (Select all that apply)
What is your priority in expanding IoT capabilities and utilizing IoT Platforms by 2020?
How connected are you with your field employees to ensure their safety and compliance with laws and policies?
What are your targets for 2020?
Questions.subtext: e.g. Injury Detection, Body Cameras, Field Team Notifications & Alerts

Questions.question: How would you rate your current capability to collect data regarding your fleet and assets?
How are you preparing for predictive and intelligent fleet and asset scheduling and cost management in 2020?
How criticial is having connectivity for always on for automated POS (e.g. vending machines, ATMs, etc) or remote monitoring stations?
What is your target amount to grow your current implementation of automated places of business or remote monitoring equipment in 2020?
How much of your job aids and documentation are you providing on a digital device that enhances and improves employees work?
How much are you planning to invest in and adopt immersive visual devices* to enhance and improve employees work?
Questions.subtext: Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, and Volumetric Displays

Questions.question: Which of the following areas do you collect data from? (Select all that apply)
How much of your 2020 strategy and vision will address 5G and IoT Everywhere?
How much of the major process groups* have the ability to monitor, control, and automate processes and/or assets in your business?
Questions.subtext: Sales & Marketing, Operations, Finance, HR, Supply Chain

Questions.question: What are your plans to move into cloud-based solutions that provide Open APIs in order to automate processes both internally and externally by 2020?
How much have you invested in remote monitoring to improve the efficiency, safety, or "green-ness" of equipment or buildings?
How much do you plan to adopt more remote monitoring to continue to improve the previous qualities and the quality of life for employees or customers?
What is the level of effort required for your customers book appointments digitally with all necessary communications?
Questions.subtext: e.g. online, mobile app, messaging app, sms, or voice assistant

Questions.question: What are your plans for implementing adaptive scheduling features to your calendar system by 2020?
Questions.subtext: e.g. accept cancellations and rebook automatically, set and update appointment length based on work

Questions.question: What is the internal priority of adopting big data & data analytics to discover hidden value in your business?
What is the internal priority, for 2020, of adopting AI and/or Machine Learning into your value chain?
Out of the areas where you collect data what insights are you focussing on in your analytics strategy? (Select all that apply)
What insights are likely to be available to help drive value in 2020? (Select all that apply)
What level of analytics does your current IoT and Fleet & Asset Tracking capabilities provide?
What are your targets for analytics of data collected from you IoT devices and sensors?
What is the probability in adopting intelligent and automated equipment drive and improve certain aspects of your business?
Questions.subtext: (Pepper, Autonomous Vehicles, other AI/EI based machinery)

Questions.question: How much do you plan on making new or further investments into intelligent and automated equipment?
Questions.subtext: (Pepper, Autonomous Vehicles, other AI/EI based machinery)

Questions.question: How would you rate your competitiveness today compared to 3 years ago?
What is your target growth rate to move up in how competitive you see yourself?
What factors do you attribute to either your growth or loss in competitiveness over the last 5 years?
What factors do you want to focus on to improve or maintain your competitiveness?
How adeptly can your business respond to change and pivot to something new or scale up to meet customer expectations?
What is level of commitment, in 2020, to adopt and invest in emerging technologies such as blockchain, smart robots, and smart workspaces?
How much do your employees use a knowledge sharing platform to collaborate on upcoming trends and market changes?
What level of plans exist to either create such a platform or expand the platform to vendors, suppliers, or strategic partners by 2020?
With your current ERP configuration, how long does it take to get to business as usual and avoid waiting time and delays?

What plans do you have to upgrade to the next-gen ERP solutions to enhance your system supported decision making, not only the value and time criticality but also risk reduction and opportunity enablement?
When challenges arise or you have an increase demand because of seasonality or milestones, how effectively can you respond internally and externally?
How much resources are you planning on allocating to improve your internal processes & tools in order to respond to challenges?
What is the level of effort required for one of your locations to undergo a system transformation?
What is the priority to include responsive communication, continuous learning, and success measurements for change management?
What is your current geographical footprint in the marketplace?
And what is your target growth into the marketplace?
Which barriers exist that impact your company's speed to market capability? (Select all that apply)
How many new locations, be it for the short-term or long-term, do you plan to open by 2020?
What barriers exist if any to form a strategic partnership to create a joint solution?

answers.5: None - We're Open to Strategic Partners

Questions.question: By 2020, what is the probability that you would form a strategic partnership to become more competitive?
How much impact would you say internal inefficiencies affect the ability of your business to continue to be competitive?
What plans exist to change corporate policy and culture to empower employees to break the status-quo and create differentiation for the company?

answers.5: Looking at a culture and policy change

Questions.question: Internally, how well known is your company's vision or goal, and can all employees relate to that goal?

answers.1: Known but difficult to Relate to

Questions.question: How thoroughly do you plan to measure individual contributions to the vision from Executives to Entry-Level employees with the support of HR systems?
What is your approach to product/service development and experimentation?
What plans have you made to include human-centered solution design as part of your innovation process?
How invested are your employees, in your vision, to create internal or product/service innovations that bring that vision closer to completion?
What are your plans in 2020 to drive innovation inside your company to become more competitive? (Select all that apply)
How much authority do employees have and know they have to bring and implement new ideas and technology to create efficiency or differentiation?
How do you plan to organize your departments and teams in 2020 to encourages experimentation with new ideas and technology?
